channel.title: Redemption Hill Church - Sermons
channel.description: Weekly sermons from Redemption Hill Church, Singapore
channel.itunes:author: Redemption Hill Church
channel.itunes:subtitle: Weekly sermons from Redemption Hill Church, Singapore
channel.itunes:summary: Each weekend our church meets to hear God's Word

item.title: Ephesians 5:22-33 - Marriage Part 1: The Blueprint, Essence And Power Of Marriage
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Earthly marriage is to be a visible display to the world of the marriage between Christ and the church. This helps us understand the blueprint, the essence and gives us the power for marriage.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Haggai

item.title: Haggai 2:10-23 - Cleansed And Liberated To Be God's House
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: God will cleanse and liberate His people from the bondage of sin, enabling them to dwell and serve before Him. Those who are truly part of this temple are blessed in Christ, forevermore.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Haggai

item.title: Haggai 2:1-9 - Whose Glory Are You Living For?
item.itunes:author: Jacob Ng
item.itunes:subtitle: God, through Haggai the prophet encourages the people to be strong and build His house. We need not fear the future, because we know the promises that God has made to us, that he is faithful to keep those promises and that his Holy Spirit remains with us.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Haggai

item.title: Haggai 2:1-9 - Be Strong and Build!
item.itunes:author: Eugene Low
item.itunes:subtitle: God, through Haggai the prophet, encourages the people to be strong and build His house. We need not fear the future, because we know the promises that God has made to us, that he is faithful to keep those promises, and that his Holy Spirit remains with us.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Haggai

item.title: Haggai 1:1-15 - Whose House Are You Building?
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: We are called to build God's house. The pursuit of our own glory ironically destroys our ability to enjoy life, but God in love has pursued us to restore us to Him that we might glory in Him.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Haggai

item.title: Psalm 90 - A Heart of True Wisdom
item.itunes:author: Jacob Ng
item.itunes:subtitle: God is eternal and glorious, while our lives on earth pass by quickly like a mist. This awareness of the fleeting nature of life, should lead us to worship Him and live all our days for His glorious purpose.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Grace

item.title: Psalm 90 - Living In The Grip of God's Grace
item.itunes:author: Eugene Low
item.itunes:subtitle: God is eternal and glorious, while our lives on earth pass by quickly like a mist. This awareness of the fleeting nature of life, in contrast with God's everlasting greatness and righteousness, should lead us to worship Him and live all our days for His glorious purpose.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Grace

item.title: Revelation 5:1-14 - Weep No More, Worship the Lamb!
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: At Christmas we remember that Jesus came as the sacrificial Lamb to ransom us from sin and darkness. We no longer need to be sad, but we can rejoice. Jesus alone is worthy because he alone can redeem us.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Christmas

item.title: Hebrews 1:1-4 - God Has Spoken Through His Son
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: God has spoken to us fully and finally through His Son who is the exact imprint of the Father. Jesus, the son, who is fully God, is better than prophets and angels, has worked in creation and for our redemption, and now has authority as the inheritor of the world who sits at the Father's right hand. We should how before Jesus in worship, and then live by faith in His name.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Christmas

item.title: Amos 9:11-15 - The Restoring King
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: God will act to restore a true King in the line of David that will restore His people and usher in a hope for the nations that will never be thwarted.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Christmas

item.title: Jeremiah 33:14-26 - Faithless Man Faithful God
item.itunes:author: Seow Aik Keong
item.itunes:subtitle: Although God's people are faithless, He remains faithful to His covenant promises. He will save His people through His King and Priest, who shall rule with justice and righteousness.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Christmas

item.title: Jeremiah 33:14-26 - Faithfulness for the Faithless, Hope for the Hopeless
item.itunes:author: Eugene Low
item.itunes:subtitle: Although God's people are faithless, He remains faithful to His covenant promises. He will save His people through His King and Priest, who shall rule with justice and righteousness.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Christmas

item.title: 2 Samuel 7:1-17 - The Promise of a King
item.itunes:author: Eugene Low
item.itunes:subtitle: God will raise up an offspring of David to rule as king of God's kingdom forever. This promised king will rule with righteousness, and bring about peace and rest for the people of God.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Christmas

item.title: 2 Samuel 7:1-17 - The Promised King
item.itunes:author: Edward Sim
item.itunes:subtitle: God will raise up an offspring of David to rule as king of God's kingdom forever. This promised king will rule with righteousness, and bring about peace and rest for the people of God.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Christmas

item.title: Genesis 49:8-12 - The Rule and Reign of the Lion of Judah
item.itunes:author: Jacob Ng
item.itunes:subtitle: God has blessed Abraham, Isaac and Jacob and set them apart to be a blessing to the nations. This blessing is passed on to Judah and one of his descendants shall be the obedience of all the peoples.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Genesis

item.title: Genesis 49:8-12 - Who Is This King?
item.itunes:author: John Ziegler
item.itunes:subtitle: God has blessed Abraham, Isaac and Jacob and set them apart to be a blessing to the nations. This blessing is passed on to Judah and one of his descendants shall be the obedience of all the peoples.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Genesis

item.title: Ephesians 5:15-21 - Living Wide Awake to God
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Living in evil days can lead us to withdraw from others, be separated from God, and self medicate to cope with the pain of life, but God saves us from our sin and gives us His Spirit which works in us to free us from other coping mechanisms, enabling us to live our lives with wisdom before God.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Ephesians

item.title: Numbers 13,14 - Breakthrough Faith
item.itunes:author: Terry Virgo
item.itunes:subtitle: Caleb was a man whose faith had certain qualities, including humility and wholeheartedness. With this kind of faith, we trust in God's promises, even when we cannot see them yet.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Numbers, Terry Virgo

item.title: Ephesians 5:2-14 - Walking As Children of Light
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: As dearly loved children, we are now to live out our lives in a way that is fitting with our status as God's holy people, which involves putting off sexual immorality, greed and crude joking.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Ephesians

item.title: Ephesians 4:31-5:2 - Imitating God in Holy Love
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Holiness is not a vague spiritual stage, but rather a very practical way to live life that is characterised by love towards others, as we imitate God who loves us perfectly.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Unity

item.title: Ephesians 4:25-30 - Living In The Neighbourhood of Holy Love
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Holiness is not a vague spiritual stage, but rather a life lived out that is devoted to God in very practical ways. It’s deeply connected to how we live our lives with other people.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Unity

item.title: Ephesians 4:17-24 - A New Way to be Holy
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Knowing Christ leads us to put off the old man in repentance and put on the new self in faith, transforming our lives to become holy.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Unity

item.title: Ephesians 4:7-16 - Built Up In Love
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Christ's victory enables us to now serve each other with the gifts God has given us so that the church can be built up in love, becoming mature in Chirst.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Unity

item.title: Ephesians 4:1-6 - Our Unity In Christ
item.itunes:author: Eugene Low
item.itunes:subtitle: God has saved us through his Son and united us as the one people of God. Therefore we are called to live in unity with one another because of who we are in Christ and because of who God is.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church, Unity

item.title: Ephesians 4:1-6 - True Christian Unity
item.itunes:author: Edward Sim
item.itunes:subtitle: God has saved us through his Son and united us as the one people of God. Therefore we are called to live in unity with one another because of who we are in Christ and because of who God is.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Acts 1:8 - The People of Mission
item.itunes:author: Aiden Spencer
item.itunes:subtitle: God has saved us through his Son and united us as the one people of God. Therefore we are called to live in unity with one another because of who we are in Christ and because of who God is.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: 1 Thessalonians 1:1-10 - The Church As The Fruit Of, And Base For Missions
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: The church is central to missions because it is both the fruit of the Gospel, as well as displayer and proclaimer of the Gospel.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: The Story of Missions
item.itunes:author: Dr Michael Lawrence
item.itunes:subtitle: Missions is not ultimately about conversion; missions is about the bigger picture of God’s glory. We are tempted to substitute our own goals for the mission that God has called us to, which is to spread the Gospel message and point to Him.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 3:14-21 - Knowing God
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Having taught extensively on what God has done for us in Christ Paul prays that the Ephesians would have deep communion with God, in order that they may live for Christ’s glory in the church.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 3:1-13 - God’s Wisdom In The Church
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: These Gentile Christians should not be discouraged by Paul’s imprisonment because this is part of God’s manifold wisdom in displaying His glory through the church, of which the Gentile believers are a key part.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 2:11-22 - From Alienation to Reconciliation - Christ is our Peace
item.itunes:author: Jacob Ng
item.itunes:subtitle: Christ’s death brings peace for each of us to God, which is the basis of our peace with each other, which means we are now fellow citizens, members of God’s household, and the new temple of God.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 2:11-22 - The Church - God's New Humanity
item.itunes:author: Eugene Low
item.itunes:subtitle: Christ’s death brings peace for each of us to God, which is the basis of our peace with each other, which means we are now fellow citizens, members of God’s household, and the new temple of God.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 2:11-22 - A New United Humanity
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Christ’s death brings peace for each of us to God, which is the basis of our peace with each other, which means we are now fellow citizens, members of God’s household, and the new temple of God.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 2:8-10 - God's Grace Changes Everything
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: If you don’t stop working in some areas that you aren’t supposed you’ll never be able to truly work in others that you are supposed to.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 2:1 - 7 - From Death to Life By Grace
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Before Christ we were dead in our sins, but now in God’s grace we have been made alive through being raised and seated with Christ.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 1:15 - 23 - Seeing our Hope, Riches and Power
item.itunes:author: Seow Aik Keong
item.itunes:subtitle: We are to pray confidently under the sovereignty of God because He has given the Church divine resources to fulfill His purpose.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 1:15 - 23 - Rejoicing in the Fullness of Christ in Us
item.itunes:author: Jacob Ng
item.itunes:subtitle: We are to pray confidently under the sovereignty of God because He has given the Church divine resources to fulfill His purpose.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 1:7-14 - Rejoicing in God's Glory
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: Understanding God’s sovereign power, His eternal plan and His good pleasure in taking a people for Himself as His own inheritance.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ephesians 1:1-6 - Rejoicing in God's Grace
item.itunes:author: Simon Murphy
item.itunes:subtitle: We are to praise God for His glorious grace of actively working to save us and make us His children through Jesus Christ.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.title: Ruth 3:1 - 4:22 - Coming to the Redeemer
item.itunes:author: Tan Huai Tze
item.itunes:subtitle: God accomplishes his purposes through the obedience of ordinary, faithful characters, who reflect his lovingkindness with one another. The story of Ruth is ultimately the story of how God sends his only Son, Jesus Christ, to redeem the lost.
item.itunes:keywords: Redemption, Singapore, sermon, Jesus, Christ, Church

item.itunes:subtitle: God accomplishes his purposes through the obedience of ordinary, faithful characters, who reflect his lovingkindness with one another. The story of Ruth is ultimately the story of how God sends his only Son, Jesus Christ, to redeem the lost.
